author: Javier Urrestarazu
title: Cardano with Ñ / Cardano in Spanish
description: The lack of knowledge about Cardano is common at non-native speaking countries where fewer resources are available in their own language.

assessments.note: Cardano should be available in mutiple languages. Spanish among them, though some numbers/justification could be added. Also rational for video vs. text translation usage and expected exposure would helpful support

The proposal does not effectively address the main goal of the challenge:  "How can application developers drive adoption of Cardano in 2021?" This proposal mostly addresses the popularization of the Cardano blockchain in  in Spanish speaking communities. This is a valid idea and deserves merit, but does not seem to tie in directly and in the best form with the Challenge.  As it is a proposed  series of videos on Youtube with general information on Cardano. it might have been better to submit it to the other Challenge: Catalyst Value Onboarding, where it might have been a better fit.

I think its  a marvelous idea, as a Spanish speaker myself I can see the large barrier in Spanish speaking countries of gaining resources and relevant information in their native tongue language needed to onboard central and south Americans into the ecosystem.  This in place would inspire developers and investor in the region to deploy their assets in those countries as well. Perhaps post more about the demographic unaware of blockchain technology, details on what resource the proposer is intending to use and the efforts of promoting, sometimes making the content doesn't equate to viewers.
The idea of serving community members in different languages is very good.At this last minute they added enough information to justify a strong rating

Like the concept - but there isn't much beyond that in itself. Proposal reads more like an idea brainstorming of what could be done but not actually how to carry it out specifically. Knowing exactly how it all ties to the mission of cardano and where we can build on that utility - it would be fantastic. That would help understanding the scope of its impact. I can probably make some assumptions but having this information directly from proposers will make it that much better.
not really provided. "We are learning how to build and maintain our own stake pool"
The proposer ist still in the learning phase of operating a stake pool. It is not stated, which kind of experience he has to offer for cardano and/or video production.
I think that the proposal is likely to be implemented successfully - although there is sparse information about the proposers and the team. This could have been fleshed out in more detail.

There's is little experience shown in the criteria, it's hard to assess your pool of resources and material that are going to be used in the youtube platform. The plan and topics are really good but more exploration on how will you achieve traction is hard to measure without a marketing strategy. The solution appear simple enough to be achievable with relatively less complex development but more clarity on content creation, editing skills, perhaps a sample of a topic edited and formatted for presentation could be given as a snippet. This could create more confidence in this proposal.
Now that they explained their experience their team's qualifications and their interest over time, and step by step approach they convinced me they will implement successfully.

There is no relevant information provided that would help us eliminate any doubts with regards to  experiences needed to carry out this project. Some links to professional profiles would be great resource - such as linked in profile, etc. There is a budget listed - but we don't know its allocation - what is it going to achieve and why this amount is what it takes. More clarity on that would allow for more sober understanding of proposed idea.
The proposer ist still in the learning phase of operating a stake pool. It is not stated, which kind of experience he has to offer for cardano and/or video production.
I think that the weakness of the proposal is mostly in the aspect of how effectively it addresses the challenge.

The topics are well outlined and there is sufficient information to imagine producible results. More clarity and example could provide confidence in the results. I imagine to start acquiring viewers  could be to onboard Spanish speaker sin the community. There is an area in the forums dedicated to Spanish speaking countries and tongues.
Finally they provided detailed information about their team their experience and commitment sufficient to justify a strong rating

There is no actual roadmap with milestones that we could lean onto and then have some KPI metrics appropriate to the effort. How are we going to measure the success? Would have loved to learn more how authors are thinking about these long term. Also, knowing what challenges do they see ahead of them as they progress with the project, any risks either? Adding these elements would greatly boost the validity of the proposal so that community can evaluate it properly.

solution: We plan to produce a series of short videos about Cardano in Spanish. The target of these videos are people who don't know Cardano.
experience: We are learning how to build and maintain our own stake pool and we would like to go for more technical projects when we are ready for it.
